business.headline: Gold shoots past Rs 1.62 lakh, silver eyes Rs 4 lakh: Should you buy now?Gold and silver remain firmly in an uptrend, but analysts warn the rally is getting stretched. With prices at record levels, should you buy precious metals or avoid them?
Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 593.83 points to 82,451.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 189.10 points to 25,364.50 as of 9:25 am.

Live: 95 crore Indians can access social security schemes, says PresidentBudget Session 2026 Live Updates: The Budget Session in the Indian Parliament will begin today. At 11 am, Indian President Draupadi Murmu will address the joint sitting of both houses, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The opposition parties will hold a meeting around 10 am to chalk out a strategy for the budget session. The opposition parties seek a discussion on issues like the VB-G RAM-G Bill and the implementation of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR). However, the Union Minister for Minority Affairs, Kiren Rijiju, has denied all possibilities of discussions on these issues, as the topics were upheld during the winter session. After today's session, all eyes will be on tomorrow, as the Economic Survey is all set to be unveiled on tomorrow's Parliament session. Catch all the live updates at indiatoday.in.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market rise today? Check hereEarly signals from the Gift Nifty suggest a firm start for the market. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,438.5 at around 8:30 AM. This points to the Nifty 50 opening above Tuesday's closing level of 25,175.4.

India-EU trade deal may not shake auto sector as much as feared. Here's whyA key part of the discussion is around import duties on cars. Under the deal, import duty on fully built imported cars, known as completely built units, could be cut sharply from around 110% to nearly 40% in the initial phase.

Shadowfax IPO listing: Will Shadowfax shares open higher or lower on BSE, NSE?Overall subscription for the Shadowfax Technologies IPO stood at 2.86 times. The retail investor category was subscribed 2.43 times, showing moderate interest from individual investors.

Budget 2026: Why investors want stability, not big surprisesOver the last few years, the government has moved decisively towards a more citizen-friendly direct tax regime, most recently visible in the new tax slabs under the reworked regime for FY 2025–26, where income up to Rs 4 lakh is now tax-free and the higher rate of 30% applies only beyond Rs 24 lakh.

India–EU trade deal a boost for long-term ties amid global uncertainty: EU VP Kaja KallasDescribed as the "mother of all deals", India–EU trade pact is expected to boost trade, lower barriers, and deepen economic ties between the two sides.

New Tax Regime explained: Key changes so far and what Budget 2026 may bringWith the core structure already in place, Budget 2026 is expected to focus on fine-tuning rather than major overhauls. The government is likely to continue strengthening the new regime as a low-tax, low-complexity option suited to a wide range of taxpayers.

Budget 2026: Will simpler rules and digital support boost India's e-commerce sector?With India's e-commerce ecosystem expanding rapidly, expectations from Budget 2026 are centred on regulatory simplicity and digital infrastructure to support millions of online sellers and platforms.

India-EU FTA explained: What the 'mother of all trade deals' means for youIndia and EU have finalised the mother of all deals, laying the groundwork for cheaper goods, stronger jobs and a deeper Indian presence in global markets. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex ends 320 points higher; Nifty above 25,100; Axis Bank up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 319.78 points to 81,857.48, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.50 points to 25,175.40 as of 3:51 PM.
Video: EU's Antonio Costa whips out Indian OCI card to PM Modi's laughterWhile talking about the historic Indo-EU trade deal, Antonio Costa speaks about his roots in Goa.

Adani Group, Embraer sign MoU for regional aircraft production in India: ReportIn a joint statement, Adani and Embraer said they had signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to explore cooperation across aircraft manufacturing, supply chains, aftermarket services and pilot training.

From cars to wine: What may get cheaper after the India–EU trade dealEuropean goods from cars and wine to olive oil and medical devices are set to become more affordable in India as tariffs fall and shoppers gain wider choice and savings.

Government plans new ATMs to dispense small currency notes: ReportWhile digital payments are growing rapidly, cash continues to play a key role in daily life for many Indians. Daily wage workers, street vendors, small shopkeepers and commuters often rely on cash for routine purchases and travel.

Budget 2026: Will senior citizens get higher tax exemption and pensions?Ahead of Budget 2026, senior citizens are seeking stronger healthcare support, higher pensions and meaningful tax relief. Experts say focused policy action is needed to build a dignified and affordable senior care ecosystem.

European cars, medicines, wine: What gets cheaper after India-EU trade dealThe biggest headline is autos. India will gradually cut tariffs on European cars to 10 per cent, a huge drop from an effective duty load that often reaches about 70 per cent today.

Silver prices jump by nearly Rs 25,000: What's behind the sudden rally?Silver prices are enjoying a rally like never before. On Tuesday, the white metal suddenly jumped by about Rs 25,000, leaving investors wondering whether this is a short-term spike or the start of a bigger trend.

India-EU trade deal: Will European cars really get cheaper?For years imported cars from Europe have attracted some of the highest duties in the world. A fully built model faces taxes of about 70% to 110%. That is the single biggest reason a BMW, Audi or Mercedes costs so much more in India than it does in Europe.

entertainment.headline: Riteish Deshmukh mourns Ajit Pawar's death; recalls dynamic leadership, kindness Actor Riteish Deshmukh expressed deep sorrow over the death of Maharashtra leader Ajit Pawar.

Sita Ramam 2? Mrunal Thakur and Dulquer Salmaan's new viral pic sparks buzz A recent image featuring Mrunal Thakur and Dulquer Salmaan has led to widespread speculation among fans about a possible sequel to Sita Ramam, though no official confirmation has been made.

Ryan Reynolds' texts on Justin Baldoni spark row. See what his representative said Ryan Reynolds' representative responded after explosive texts surfaced in court records. The messages targeted Justin Baldoni during Blake Lively's ongoing dispute.

Timeline: Salman Khan feud to viral storm, when Arijit Singh hit wrong headlines Arijit Singh, the celebrated Indian playback singer, has recently announced a pause on new projects, stirring surprise and concern among fans. His journey has been marked by both soulful music and notable controversies, including a public feud with Salman Khan and viral incidents.

Dhanush visits Tirupati temple with sons, Yatra and Lingaa. Pics and videos out Actor Dhanush visited Tirumala Tirupati temple on Wednesday with his sons Yatra and Lingaa. The visit comes amid ongoing film projects and fan excitement.

Sadiyon mein ek: Badshah, B Praak and others on Arijit Singh's playback exit Celebrities, including Badshah, B Praak and Amaal Mallik, reacted emotionally to Arijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing. The announcement came on the singer's social media on Tuesday night.

Sunny vs Sunny in Border franchise: Soldiers' hearts beyond the battlefield In the 1971 war's cinematic universe, Sunny Deol's roles evolve from Major Kuldeep Singh Chandpuri's ironclad patriotism to Lt Col Fateh Singh Kaler's raw grief, blending duty with human frailty. As Border 2 creates box office storm, it's time to dissect how these soldiers size up — similar in valour, worlds apart in vulnerability.

After Border 2's success, makers confirm Border 3 is on the cards The success of 'Border 2' has led to confirmation of a third installment in the 'Border' franchise, with T-Series & JP Films planning further collaboration with the third part.

Emraan Hashmi on Taskaree's Global Netflix No 1 Run: Didn't expect it | Exclusive In an exclusive conversation with India Today, Emraan Hashmi spoke about his recent career graph with his latest releases like 'Haq', 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' and 'Taskaree' creating waves in the industry.

Zakir Khan cites genetic illness behind comedy break: Need to take care of health Zakir Khan opened up about his extended break from stand-up comedy, citing health concerns and genetic illnesses in his family. The comedian said years of overwork and lack of rest forced him to prioritise his well-being.

Devara 2 producer confirms shoot will begin in May, rejects shelving rumours Amid constant rumours about Jr NTR and director Koratala Siva's Devara: Part 2 being shelved, producer Sudhakar Mikkilineni addressed speculation about the status of the project. The first part received mixed reviews.

No fine, penalty issued: Varun Dhawan's team clarifies after Mumbai Metro warning After Varun Dhawan received a stern warning from Mumbai Metro officials over his viral video, his team released a statement clarifying that no fine or penalty had been imposed.

Hollywood sign stunt row: Sydney Sweeney didn't have permission, say officials Sydney Sweeney faced scrutiny after displaying bras on the Hollywood sign without authorisation from the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce or the Hollywood Sign Trust. Authorities confirmed that no prior permission was obtained for the stunt.

Border 2 box office Day 5: Sunny Deol's film crosses Rs 200 crore mark Sunny Deol's war drama Border 2 crossed the Rs 200 crore mark in India on Wednesday, with strong earnings over its extended Republic Day weekend. It posed a robust competition to recent holiday releases and halted Dhurandhar's impressive run at the box office.

Border 2: Varun Dhawan's chemistry with Medha Rana is his best romantic act so far In Border 2, Varun Dhawan delivered his most convincing on-screen romance yet. He found silence and chemistry opposite newcomer Medha Rana in a love story defined by sacrifice and emotional maturity.

I've grown weary: Arijit Singh on stepping away from playback singing Singer Arijit Singh has outlined multiple reasons for his decision to step back from playback singing. He also assured fans that he would fulfil existing commitments and continue making music.

Amrita Singh traumatised me: Orry opens up on fallout with Sara Ali Khan Social media influencer Orry opened up about his fallout with Sara Ali Khan and her family, saying the feud can only end if Amrita Singh apologises. He also addresses unfollows, online jabs, and remarks about Sara's acting career.

Kanye West clarifies apology for antisemitic remarks isn't a PR move for Bully Kanye West addressed scepticism around his public apology and dismissed claims it was a PR move ahead of his album Bully. In a recent interview, the rapper opened up about remorse, mental health struggles, and taking responsibility for his past actions.
Hema Malini recalls painful barefoot dance shoot for iconic Sholay song Hema Malini recalled the tough conditions behind her iconic Jab Tak Hai Jaan dance sequence.

general news.headline: How Ajit Pawar's death leaves Maha politics facing biggest questions in yearsAjit Pawar's sudden death has left a void in Maharashtra politics. A mass leader, power broker and strategist, his absence might unsettle the ruling Mahayuti and throw the future of a divided NCP into doubt. It raises questions over leadership and succession in the NCP camp.

Ajit Pawar was flying in Bombardier Learjet 45; operator says it was 100% safeThe aircraft, operated by VSR and registered as VT-SSK, went down at Baramati while attempting to land. The occurrence report states that the jet "crash-landed at Baramati" and that "no person on board has survived the crash."

India came out on top: US trade chief says EU deal tilts in Delhi's favourThe US trade chief has said India will emerge as the biggest beneficiary of its landmark trade deal with the EU, gaining wider market access and potentially enhanced mobility for Indian workers in Europe.

It ain't over till it's over: How India changed the game in weeksIn weeks' time, India has changed the mood on trade deals. From being portrayed as a loser by Trump aide Howard Lutnick, New Delhi now seems to have the upper hand in India-US trade negotiations. It has finalised the India-EU FTA and will be hosting the Canadian PM in March. This after sealing an FTA with New Zealand.

Amrita Singh traumatised me: Orry opens up on fallout with Sara Ali KhanSocial media influencer Orry opened up about his fallout with Sara Ali Khan and her family, saying the feud can only end if Amrita Singh apologises. He also addresses unfollows, online jabs, and remarks about Sara's acting career.

Day 11 Live Updates: Musetti takes medical timeout as Djokovic amps up pressureAustralian Open, Day 11 Live Updates: Italy's Lorenzo Musetti wins the first two sets against Novak Djokovic. The Serbian is in huge trouble in the quarter-final of the competition as he struggles to cope against the backhands of the Italian.

Priyanka Chaturvedi tears up over Ajit Pawar's death: Huge loss for stateMaharashtra mourns the tragic loss of Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar in a charter aircraft crash, marking a huge setback for the state. His dedication and bright ideas for Maharashtra's progress have left a lasting impact on all.
Riteish Deshmukh mourns Ajit Pawar's death; recalls dynamic leadership, kindnessActor Riteish Deshmukh expressed deep sorrow over the death of  Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

Ajit Dada: Mass leader who practised politics with no permanent friends or enemiesMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar died on Wednesday morning after a chartered aircraft crashed while attempting an emergency landing at Baramati airport. Two pilots and his two security personnel were also killed in the accident.

Live: 95 crore Indians can access social security schemes, says PresidentBudget Session 2026 Live Updates: The Budget Session in the Indian Parliament will begin today. At 11 am, Indian President Draupadi Murmu will address the joint sitting of both houses, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The opposition parties will hold a meeting around 10 am to chalk out a strategy for the budget session. The opposition parties seek a discussion on issues like the VB-G RAM-G Bill and the implementation of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR). However, the Union Minister for Minority Affairs, Kiren Rijiju, has denied all possibilities of discussions on these issues, as the topics were upheld during the winter session. After today's session, all eyes will be on tomorrow, as the Economic Survey is all set to be unveiled on tomorrow's Parliament session. Catch all the live updates at indiatoday.in.

Ajit Pawar was a leader of the people: PM Modi mourns Maharashtra Deputy CMMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar tragically died in a charter aircraft crash near Pune, leaving the state and nation in deep mourning. Leaders across political parties have expressed their grief and called for a thorough investigation into the accident.

Supreme Court agrees to hear plea challenging UGC's new anti-discrimination rulesThe plea was mentioned before a bench led by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant. The petitioner argued that the new regulations are discriminatory towards General Category students.

Why the red sky over Ladakh's Hanle is a warning India can't ignoreThe red auroras over Hanle are a stunning visual of intense solar activity. These celestial displays are a warning for India's satellites and power grids.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Trump says he doesn't have Alzheimer's, but forgets name of the diseaseScrutiny of Trump's health intensified recently following a series of public moments, from stumbling while boarding Air Force One and appearing to doze off during Cabinet meetings to unexplained bruising on his hands, swelling in his ankles, and a brief disappearance from public view.

I've grown weary: Arijit Singh on stepping away from playback singingSinger Arijit Singh has outlined multiple reasons for his decision to step back from playback singing. He also assured fans that he would fulfil existing commitments and continue making music.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 18 | The birth of anti-BrahminismThe alarm now goes off, and it is time to wake up and ride the turbulent tide: a transition from the profound poetry of Tamil Bhakti to the pungent theatre of Dravidian politics.

Video: US lawmaker Ilhan Omar sprayed with unknown substance at town hallThe video shows a man spraying an unknown substance in Ilhan Omar's direction from a very short range.

Air India Express pilot retires, daughter narrates video of his final flightAir India Express pilot Om takes his final flight as his daughter narrates a wholesome farewell video, marking the end of his distinguished aviation career.

Will Artemis-II be delayed? Big hurdles that could threaten Moon launchThe Artemis-II crew has entered quarantine, but technical issues with Orion and the launch pad could force a delay. Nasa is prioritising a critical fuelling test on January 31 before confirming the February lift-off.

India-EU trade deal may not shake auto sector as much as feared. Here's whyA key part of the discussion is around import duties on cars. Under the deal, import duty on fully built imported cars, known as completely built units, could be cut sharply from around 110% to nearly 40% in the initial phase.

Texas freezes fresh H-1B visas at state colleges, agencies to protect US workersTexas Governor Greg Abbott claims the H-1B programme has been misused to replace qualified American workers, arguing state agencies must prioritise Texans and demonstrate good-faith recruitment before hiring foreign labour.
Delhi sees wettest January in four years, rainy start to February likelyOn January 8, 2022, the city recorded rainfall of 40.6 mm, which is still the highest in recent years.

sports.headline: Tottenham Hotspur and France forward Randal Kolo Muani involved in car crash Tottenham forward Randal Kolo Muani was involved in a minor car accident while travelling for Champions League duty. Manager Thomas Frank confirmed the French striker is fine and expected to be available.

India favourites in T20 World Cup, but Dravid warns against one bad day in office Former India head coach Rahul Dravid believes that India start as the favourites in the T20 World Cup. However, Dravid has warned that one bad day can undo years of good work.

Are we tennis players or animals in a zoo? Swiatek lashes out at AUS Open broadcasters Iga Swiatek has questioned the intense behind-the-scenes coverage at the Australian Open after her quarter-final exit. The world No. 2 backed Coco Gauff's call for more privacy away from the court.

Abhishek Sharma better than Chris Gayle? Former India star's big praise for opener Mohammed Kaif has compared Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting to Chris Gayle after his New Zealand onslaught. The former India batter said Abhishek's consistency and instant impact set him apart from most power-hitters.

Time to stop tinkering? Should India play their T20 World Cup XI vs New Zealand India have been ringing in the changes in every single game of the New Zealand series so far. While testing the bench strength is needed, the Indian team should be playing their best side at all times just before the T20 World Cup 2026.

4th T20I preview: Sanju Samson seeks a spark as Vizag braces for a storm India vs New Zealand, 4th T20I preview: India's marauding T20 machine descends on Vizag for the fourth instalment of what has been a one-sided series so far. Sanju Samson will be in focus as the star opener hopes to find form after an extended training session on Tuesday.

Abhishek Sharma posts new photo, Yuvraj Singh steals show with hilarious taunt Yuvraj Singh poked fun at in-form India opener Abhishek Sharma after his latest social media post. The mentor's cheeky comment came as Abhishek continues his blazing run in T20Is.

Brook, Root hundreds help England put behind Ashes horror, seal series vs SL Harry Brook and Joe Root's hundreds were enough for England to put behind their Ashes disappointment and get winning momentum on their side as they sealed the ODI series against Sri Lanka.

Day 11 Live Updates: Musetti leading two sets to nil against Djokovic Australian Open, Day 11 Live Updates: Italy's Lorenzo Musetti wins the first two sets against Novak Djokovic. The Serbian is in huge trouble in the quarter-final of the competition as he struggles to cope against the backhands of the Italian.

Jemimah urges quick regroup as Delhi Capitals' playoff hopes hang by a thread WPL 2026, DC vs GG: Jemimah Rodrigues said that Delhi Capitals (DC) need to recover from their defeat against Gujarat Giants and regroup before their must-win clash against the UP Warriorz.

Sophie Devine haunts Delhi Capitals again as Gujarat Giants survive late thrillerWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Sophie Devine defended nine runs in the last over as the Gujarat Giants beat the Jemimah Rodrigues-led Delhi Capitals on Tuesday to stay alive in the race for the playoffs.

Vijay Amritraj on receiving Padma Bhushan: My wife and I were in tearsVijay Amritraj recalls the emotional moment he learnt about his Padma Bhushan honour, becoming the only sportsperson to receive the award this year. Amritraj was honoured for his contributions to tennis during his storied career.

IND vs NZ, 4th T20I: Axar set for return, but who will make way in Vizag?India vs New Zealand 4th T20I predicted XIs: India are all set to back Sanju Samson at the top and Axar Patel is all set to make his return to the side after recovering from his injury early on in the series.

Give your life: Vijay Amritraj on the toughest challenge in individual sports in IndiaIn the special segment, India Today's Rajdeep Sardesai speaks with tennis legend Vijay Amritraj following the announcement of his Padma Bhushan award in the sports category. Amritraj emphasized that for young athletes to succeed in individual sports in India, dedication to their chosen sport from an early age is essential.

Sanju Samson finds his flow in Vizag nets, Shreyas Iyer enjoys a marathonIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson and Shreyas Iyer had extended batting sessions in Visakhapatnam during India's optional training on Tuesday. Axar Patel, returning from injury, eased into rhythm as India showed no signs of loosening their grip on the series against a New Zealand side struggling for answers.

U19 World Cup: Vihaan Malhotra's 109 powers India to 204-run win over ZimbabweVihaan Malhotra's century powered India to a dominant 204-run win over Zimbabwe in their first Super Six match of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 at the Queen's Sports Club in Bulawayo on Tuesday.

SA20 wants to have coach Sourav Ganguly back despite final heartbreak: Graeme SmithDespite suffering another final heartbreak in South Africa, Graeme Smith wants to see Sourav Ganguly make a return to the SA20 as a coach. Ganguly helped Pretoria Capitals reach the final of the SA20 2026 season.

Rohit Sharma led India's white-ball evolution from the front: Rahul DravidRahul Dravid reflected on India's rise in white-ball cricket and the evolution of leadership within the team, while crediting Rohit Sharma for spearheading the change.

Aryna Sabalenka wins hearts with cheeky birthday request to Carlos AlcarazAryna Sabalenka sparked a fun moment at the 2026 Australian Open after her quarter-final win, joking that she would gift Carlos Alcaraz a TikTok dance in a nod to their shared birthday and past viral clip.

SL vs ENG: Brook channels inner Stone Cold Steve Austin after hundred in 3rd ODIHarry Brook decided to channel his inner Stone Cold Steve Austin as he celebrated his incredible knock against Sri Lanka by imitating the WWE legend's iconic beer smash. Brook and Root's hundreds helped England post 357 against Sri Lanka in the series decider.

Nikhil Naaz Hosts ICC T20 World Cup Trophy At India Today MediaPlex Ahead Of 2026 TournamentOn this Special Report, India Today's Nikhil Naaz provides an exclusive close-up look at the ICC T20 World Cup trophy at the network's Noida office. Highlighting India's status as defending champions, Naaz notes, 'India going to this particular tournament as the defending champion' with a chance to become the first team to win the title three times. The transcript details India's formidable form, having won 32 matches with only five losses in the last 18 months. The tournament is scheduled to begin on 7th February 2026, with the final on 8th March. Naaz discusses the $2.5 million prize money and praises the Indian squad, featuring stars like Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, and Jasprit Bumrah. The report also touches upon the historical significance of the trophy, tracing back to MS Dhoni's 2007 victory, while contrasting the current accessibility of the silverware with previous controversies involving other cricket tournaments.

DC vs Gujarat Giants Highlights: Gujarat survive thriller, beat Delhi by 3 runsDelhi Capitals (DC) vs Gujarat Giants (GGW), WPL 2026 Highlights: Gujarat Giants beat Delhi Capitals by three runs in Vadodara after Sophie Devien defended nine runs in the last over. Niki Prasad's 47-run run for Delhi went in vain.

Who is Vihaan Malhotra? RCB starlet scores India's 1st hundred in U19 World Cup 2026Vihaan Malhotra slammed the first Indian hundred of the U19 World Cup 2026, scoring an unbeaten 109 vs Zimbabwe as India posted 352 in Bulawayo. Here's a look at a quick profile of the Indian vice-captain, who has been a key figure in India's campaign so far.

Sanju will find form: India bowling coach backs Samson ahead of T20 World CupIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has played down concerns over Sanju Samson's form slump, backing the wicketkeeper-batter to rediscover his touch ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Ex-India batter Jacob Martin arrested for drunk driving after accident in VadodaraFormer Indian cricketer Jacob Martin was arrested for drink-driving after crashing into parked cars in Vadodara on Monday. Martin played 10 ODIs for India from 1999 to 2001.

Don't support Bangladesh at the cost of Pakistan cricket: Ex-Pak playersPakistan should avoid harming its relationship with the world governing body, and support for Bangladesh should not come at the cost of national cricket, former players and board officials said as the PCB deferred its decision on participating in the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Carlos Alcaraz nears Career Grand Slam dream with maiden semis berthAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz stormed into his maiden semi-final at Melbourne Park after beating Alex de Minaur in straight sets and will next be up against Alexander Zverev.

Injuries suck, but rare breed Lockie Ferguson refuses to slow downIn an era of flat decks and relentless schedules, the 150kph tearaway is a dying breed. Lockie Ferguson opens up on the gruelling reality of rehab, casual contracts, and why, despite the physical toll, he refuses to turn down the heat.

Coco Gauff destroys racket in anger after AUS Open exit, video goes viralCoco Gauff was defeated by Elina Svitolina in just over an hour during the Australian Open quarterfinals, leading to her visible frustration. Gauff smashed her racket in the corridors of the arena after the loss.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
